members.description:
Switches HP ProLiant server to UEFI boot mode and Powers Off.

The target server will be powered off when the boot mode switching was successful.

* HP ProLiant server with iLO
* HP ProLiant server capable of booting into different bootmodes

Custom Attributes: None

members.name: ProLiant HW - Add Migrated Windows Server

buildPlanItems.name: Hponcfg for Windows x64 with One Time PXE Boot

members.description:
Registers migrated server's iLO with appliance.  It uses Scripting Toolkit provided hponcfg utility
(c) Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

Note:  The server will be booted into the LinuxPE environment where the server's iLO will be registered and then booted back into production.

Requirements:
* Runs only on ProLiant Server with an iLOrunning Windows x64 architecture
* Appliance must support DHCP/PXE

CustomAttributes: None

members.name: ProLiant SW - Validate Media Server Settings
members.description:
Validates the media server configuration and the data entered on the media server settings page.

All forms of access are tested and diagnostic messages are output to the job log. Use this build plan to troubleshoot media server access problems.

(c) Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

Requirements:
This build plan does not boot the target server. It must be run against a server that is either booted to a service OS or already running a Windows or Linux production OS

members.name: ProLiant HW - System ROM Enable Virtualization

buildPlanItems.name: ProLiant Scripting Toolkit for Linux x64 - gen9snap3

members.description:
Enables Support for Hardware-Assisted Virtualization in the System ROM on ProLiant servers.
(c) Copyright 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

- Enables No Execute Memory Protection.
- Enables CPU Virtualization.

Requirements:
* HP ProLiant Server with iLO

Custom Attributes: None

Required Custom Attributes:  None

Optional Custom Attributes:
* encrypted_root_password (must be encrypted)
* boot_disk
* kernel_arguments

Note: No new RHEL 5.10 drivers are available after 2014.06.0.

members.name: ProLiant HW - Clear UEFI Boot Menu
members.description: Deletes the custom boot options from the UEFI boot menu.  These are boot options that were added to the UEFI boot menu by previously installed OSs or manually by the user.  This Build Plan removes all the custom boot options, even the one for the currently installed OS, so it should only be run if you are planning to install a new OS, otherwise your currently installed OS may fail to boot.

members.name: ProLiant HW - Prepare for Windows Reprovisioning
members.description:
Prepares a provisioned target server for reprovisioning by decommissioning it and placing it in maintenance mode.
(c) Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

Requirements:
* HP ProLiant server with iLO

Custom Attributes: None

members.name: ProLiant HW - Add Migrated Linux Server
members.description:
Registers a migrated server's iLO with appliance.  It uses the hpbootcfg utility to set a one time PXE boot.
(c) Copyright 2013 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P.

Note: The server will be booted into the LinuxPE environment where the server's iLO will be registered and then booted back into production.

Requirements:
* Runs only on ProLiant Servers with iLO running Linux
* Appliance must have DHCP/PXE support
* Presence of /sbin/hpbootcfg

CustomAttributes: None
